title: Trump Drops Demand for Cash From Harvard After Stiff Resistance
summary: The Trump administration has lowered the bar for a deal with the university, backtracking on its insistence on a $200 million payment to the government, The New York Times has learned.

title: Trump, in an Escalation, Calls for Republicans to ‘Nationalize’ Elections
summary: The comments, made on a conservative podcast, follow a string of moves from his administration to try to exert more control over American elections.

title: Gabbard Arranges Trump Call With FBI Agents After Georgia Election Center Search
summary: Tulsi Gabbard, the director of national intelligence, brokered the call and President Trump directly questioned frontline agents on the inquiry, The Times has learned.

title: Immigration Officers in Minneapolis Will Wear Body Cameras, Noem Says
summary: The change comes as the federal government has provided accounts of fatal shootings that have sometimes conflicted with local officials and witness videos.

title: Federal Judge Blocks Trump Administration From Ending TPS for Haitians
summary: The ruling pauses the Trump administration’s plan to end a program that has allowed more than 330,000 people from Haiti to remain in the United States.

title: Minnesota Economy Suffers as I.C.E. Cracks Down
summary: Immigration raids have scared off customers and workers, a pattern repeated in other cities where federal officials have arrived in force.

title: U.S. Military Tells Alaska and N.C. Troops to Stand Down on Possible Minnesota Deployment
summary: More than 1,500 active-duty troops had been on standby to deploy to Minnesota, but were quietly taken off heightened alert over the weekend.

title: Clintons Capitulate on House Epstein Inquiry, Agreeing to Testify
summary: Former President Bill Clinton and Hillary Clinton, the ex-secretary of state, agreed to depositions they had long resisted days before the House was to vote to hold them in contempt.

title: Epstein Victims Ask Judge to Shut D.O.J. Website After Names Disclosed
summary: A judge will hold a hearing on Wednesday after attorneys for victims in the Epstein case said the recent batch of documents released by the government included their names.

title: Peter Attia, CBS News Contributor, ‘Ashamed’ After Epstein Files Made Public
summary: The longevity influencer said he “never witnessed illegal behavior” but would not defend his crude remarks about women and comments on Jeffrey Epstein’s “outrageous” life.

title: Brad Karp Says He Regrets Interactions with Epstein
summary: Newly released emails between Mr. Karp, the chairman of Paul Weiss, and Jeffrey Epstein reveal a number of social interactions between them.

title: Deal to Reopen Government Is Imperiled in the House
summary: Some hard-line House Republicans have balked at the agreement Senate Democrats struck with President Trump to fund the government, complicating its path to enactment.

title: Stars Bring ‘ICE OUT’ Pins and Fiery Speeches to a Political Grammys
summary: Bad Bunny, Billie Eilish and Kehlani made strong statements about immigration on Sunday, while the host Trevor Noah drew President Trump’s ire.

title: Elon Musk Merges SpaceX With His A.I. Start-Up xAI
summary: The deal further intermingles Mr. Musk’s companies and creates the most valuable private company on earth.

title: Waymo Raises $16 Billion to Fuel Global Ambitions
summary: The self-driving car company, an arm of Google’s parent company, is rapidly expanding its service beyond a handful of cities.

title: New York City’s First Real Winter in a Long Time Is Relentless
summary: Mountains of rock-solid filthy snow. Narrow, icy sidewalks. Temperatures that sound like shoe sizes. When will it end?

title: The Wonder Drug That’s Plaguing Sports
summary: Ostarine held the promise of profound medical treatments. Something unexpected happened on the way to F.D.A. approval.

title: ‘Today’ Anchor Savannah Guthrie’s Mother Is Missing, Authorities Say
summary: Savannah Guthrie’s mother, Nancy, 84, was last seen on Saturday near her home in Tucson, Ariz. A sheriff said on Monday that investigators were treating her disappearance as a crime.

title: Mayor Mamdani and the Taxi Driver
summary: Richard Chow befriended Zohran Mamdani five years ago and has driven him to City Hall and Gracie Mansion.

title: Attempt to Drill Through Thwaites Glacier Is Foiled
summary: Scientists lost their instruments within Antarctica’s most dangerously unstable glacier, though not before getting a glimpse at the warming waters underneath.

title: Will the Spirit of 1976 Come to 2026?
summary: Bicentennial celebrations across America were spirited and joyous. As the semiquincentennial approaches, there’s a different mood.

title: How a Conservative Texas District Rejected the Politics of Division
summary: Many Americans are growing both exhausted and frightened by Trump’s scorched-earth, hyperpartisan, fire-ready-aim approach to the presidency.

title: Much of Silicon Valley Remains Mum About Minneapolis. Here’s Why.
summary: In a shaky job market, Silicon Valley workers feel they lack the leverage needed to make their political views known.

title: Trump Talked to Agents Investigating Election Claims
summary: Also, the Supreme Court secretly made itself even more secretive. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: U.S. and Iranian Officials to Meet as Trump’s Threats Loom
summary: President Trump’s Middle East envoy and his son-in-law were expected to meet Iran’s foreign minister in Istanbul on Friday amid tensions between the countries.

title: John Forté, Hip-Hop Redemption Tale, Dies at 50
summary: He seemed destined for a glittering career, working with the Fugees and solo, then landed in prison. After a presidential pardon, he clawed his way back.

title: ‘I Didn’t Have Time to Think,’ Says Sergeant Who Threw Cooler at Man
summary: Erik Duran, an N.Y.P.D. sergeant, said he was trying to save lives when he struck Eric Duprey with a cooler. The sergeant took the unusual step of testifying at his own manslaughter trial.

title: Brendan Banfield Found Guilty in Virginia Double Murder Trial
summary: Prosecutors said Brendan Banfield carried out an elaborate scheme using a fetish website in 2023 to kill his wife and another man.
